oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oeuvre du Souvenir des Defenseusrs de Verdun; Monumont de Douaumont
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A promotional certificate for the memorial dedicated to the defenders of Verdun and Douaumont. It features a sketch by Georges Scott of a fallen French soldier being attended by a nurse. The broadside states it is a memorial to the French and Allied soldiers "gloriously entombed" at the great battle of Verdun and features a personal message from General Philippe Petain.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Verdun, Battle of, Verdun, France, 1914; World War - 1914-1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Battle of Verdun took place between February and December 1916. A German army under Erich von Falkenhayn assaulted the French fortresses of Douamont and Verdun until driven back by the French defenders under Philippe Petain and Robert Neville. The battle resulted in a French halt to the German advance.
